messages.message:
i haven't had issues with the mypy conflict. i'm kiknd of surprised we haven't since we pip freeze the requirements, so should have been warned about conflicts.

i also don't run make build-thrift.. so haven't see the stubgen issue
well the mypy==0.701 isn’t in requirements.txt, that’s something we do separately. So I don’t think pip-compile would catch it.
As a temp fix, I just re-ran `python3 -m pip install -U mypy==0.701` which upgraded `mypy-extensions-0.4.3`

fyi @lydia @Heymian we can now move pip install mypy==0.701 into our global requirements.txt — the reason it wasn’t there before was due to the whole py2 / py3 thing. Now that we’re always py3 — we can just install it in our requirements.txt directly
also we can upgrade our mypy-extensions to the upgraded version 0.4.3 no problem
